properties.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued January 30 at 5:57PM MST until January 30 at 6:45PM MST by NWS Denver CO
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Denver Colorado has issued a

* Snow Squall Warning for...
Northwestern Weld County in northeastern Colorado...
Northeastern Larimer County in north central Colorado...

* Until 645 PM MST.

* At 557 PM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line
extending from near Grover to near Federal, or along a line
extending from 38 miles northeast of Greeley to 20 miles northwest
of Cheyenne, moving south at 40 mph.

HAZARD...Heavy snow and blowing snow. Wind gusts up to 40 mph.

SOURCE...Radar and webcams.

IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel.

* This includes Interstate 25 between mile markers 272 and 297.

Locations impacted include...
Wellington, Eaton, Severance, Ault, Pierce, Nunn, Grover, Purcell,
Carr, Galeton, Livermore, Natural Fort, Barnesville, Rockport,
Hereford and Briggsdale.
properties.instruction:
Consider avoiding or delaying travel until the snow squall passes
your location. If you must travel, use extra caution and allow extra
time. Rapid changes in visibility and slick road conditions may lead
to accidents.

Wet roadways will quickly freeze. Black ice will cause roads, bridges
and overpasses to become slick and dangerous. Slow down and be
prepared for sudden loss of traction.

CMAMtext: Snow Squall Warning til 6:45 PM MST. Sudden whiteouts. Icy roads. Slow down! -NWS
